children.name: Capacity
children.description: Engine oil capacity in liters.

children.name: Level
children.description: Engine oil level.

children.name: LifeRemaining
children.description: Remaining engine oil life in seconds. Negative values can be used to indicate that lifetime has been exceeded.
children.comment: In addition to this a signal a vehicle can report remaining time to service (including e.g. oil change) by Vehicle.Service.TimeToService.

children.name: Temperature
children.description: EOT, Engine oil temperature.

children.name: Capacity
children.description: Engine coolant capacity in liters.

children.name: Temperature
children.description: Engine coolant temperature.

children.name: Level
children.description: Engine coolant level.

children.name: LifeRemaining
children.description: Remaining engine coolant life in seconds. Negative values can be used to indicate that lifetime has been exceeded.
children.comment: In addition to this a signal a vehicle can report remaining time to service (including e.g. coolant change) by Vehicle.Service.TimeToService.

children.name: Capacity
children.description: Capacity in liters of the Diesel Exhaust Fluid Tank.

children.name: Level
children.description: Level of the Diesel Exhaust Fluid tank as percent of capacity. 0 = empty. 100 = full.

children.name: Range
children.description: Remaining range in meters of the Diesel Exhaust Fluid present in the vehicle.

children.name: IsLevelLow
children.description: Indicates if the Diesel Exhaust Fluid level is low. True if level is low. Definition of low is vehicle dependent.

children.name: InletTemperature
children.description: Inlet temperature of Diesel Particulate Filter.

children.name: OutletTemperature
children.description: Outlet temperature of Diesel Particulate Filter.

children.name: DeltaPressure
children.description: Delta Pressure of Diesel Particulate Filter.

children.name: EngineCode
children.description: Engine code designation, as specified by vehicle manufacturer.
children.comment: For hybrid vehicles the engine code may refer to the combination of combustion and electric engine.

children.name: Displacement
children.description: Displacement in cubic centimetres.

children.name: StrokeLength
children.description: Stroke length in millimetres.

children.name: Bore
children.description: Bore in millimetres.

children.name: Configuration
children.description: Engine configuration.

children.name: NumberOfCylinders
children.description: Number of cylinders.

children.name: NumberOfValvesPerCylinder
children.description: Number of valves per cylinder.

children.name: CompressionRatio
children.description: Engine compression ratio, specified in the format 'X:1', e.g. '9.2:1'.

children.name: EngineOilCapacity
children.description: Engine oil capacity in liters.

children.name: EngineCoolantCapacity
children.description: Engine coolant capacity in liters.

children.name: MaxPower
children.description: Peak power, in kilowatts, that engine can generate.

children.name: MaxTorque
children.description: Peak torque, in newton meter, that the engine can generate.

children.name: AspirationType
children.description: Type of aspiration (natural, turbocharger, supercharger etc).

children.name: EngineOilLevel
children.description: Engine oil level.

children.name: OilLifeRemaining
children.description: Remaining engine oil life in seconds. Negative values can be used to indicate that lifetime has been exceeded.
children.comment: In addition to this a signal a vehicle can report remaining time to service (including e.g. oil change) by Vehicle.Service.TimeToService.

children.name: IsRunning
children.description: Engine Running. True if engine is rotating (Speed > 0).

children.name: Speed
children.description: Engine speed measured as rotations per minute.

children.name: EngineHours
children.description: Accumulated time during engine lifetime with 'engine speed (rpm) > 0'.

children.name: IdleHours
children.description: Accumulated idling time during engine lifetime. Definition of idling is not standardized.
children.comment: Vehicles may calculate accumulated idle time for an engine. It might be based on engine speed (rpm) below a certain limit or any other mechanism.

children.name: ECT
children.description: Engine coolant temperature.

children.name: EOT
children.description: Engine oil temperature.

children.name: MAP
children.description: Manifold absolute pressure possibly boosted using forced induction.

children.name: MAF
children.description: Grams of air drawn into engine per second.

children.name: TPS
children.description: Current throttle position.

children.name: EOP
children.description: Engine oil pressure.

children.name: Power
children.description: Current engine power output. Shall be reported as 0 during engine breaking.

children.name: Torque
children.description: Current engine torque. Shall be reported as a negative number during engine breaking.
children.comment: During engine breaking the engine delivers a negative torque to the transmission.

children.name: SelectedGear
children.description: The selected gear. 0=Neutral, 1/2/..=Forward, -1/-2/..=Reverse, 126=Park, 127=Drive.

children.name: IsParkLockEngaged
children.description: Is the transmission park lock engaged or not. False = Disengaged. True = Engaged.

children.name: IsLowRangeEngaged
children.description: Is gearbox in low range mode or not. False = Normal/High range engaged. True = Low range engaged.
children.comment: The possibility to switch between low and high gear range is typically only available in heavy vehicles and off-road vehicles.

children.name: IsElectricalPowertrainEngaged
children.description: Is electrical powertrain mechanically connected/engaged to the drivetrain or not. False = Disconnected/Disengaged. True = Connected/Engaged.
children.comment: In some hybrid solutions it is possible to disconnect/disengage the electrical powertrain mechanically to avoid induced voltage reaching a too high level when driving at high speed.

children.name: PerformanceMode
children.description: Current gearbox performance mode.

children.name: GearChangeMode
children.description: Is the gearbox in automatic or manual (paddle) mode.

children.name: ClutchEngagement
children.description: Clutch engagement. 0% = Clutch fully disengaged. 100% = Clutch fully engaged.

children.name: DiffLockFrontEngagement
children.description: Front Diff Lock engagement. 0% = Diff lock fully disengaged. 100% = Diff lock fully engaged.

children.name: DiffLockRearEngagement
children.description: Rear Diff Lock engagement. 0% = Diff lock fully disengaged. 100% = Diff lock fully engaged.

children.name: TorqueDistribution
children.description: Torque distribution between front and rear axle in percent. -100% = Full torque to front axle, 0% = 50:50 Front/Rear, 100% = Full torque to rear axle.

children.name: Type
children.description: Transmission type.

children.name: GearCount
children.description: Number of forward gears in the transmission. -1 = CVT.

children.name: DriveType
children.description: Drive type.

children.name: TravelledDistance
children.description: Odometer reading, total distance travelled during the lifetime of the transmission.

children.name: CurrentGear
children.description: The current gear. 0=Neutral, 1/2/..=Forward, -1/-2/..=Reverse.

children.name: Temperature
children.description: The current gearbox temperature.

children.name: ClutchWear
children.description: Clutch wear as a percent. 0 = no wear. 100 = worn.

children.name: Capacity
children.description: Engine coolant capacity in liters.

children.name: Temperature
children.description: Engine coolant temperature.

children.name: Level
children.description: Engine coolant level.

children.name: LifeRemaining
children.description: Remaining engine coolant life in seconds. Negative values can be used to indicate that lifetime has been exceeded.
children.comment: In addition to this a signal a vehicle can report remaining time to service (including e.g. coolant change) by Vehicle.Service.TimeToService.

children.name: EngineCode
children.description: Engine code designation, as specified by vehicle manufacturer.

children.name: MaxPower
children.description: Peak power, in kilowatts, that motor(s) can generate.

children.name: MaxTorque
children.description: Peak power, in newton meter, that the motor(s) can generate.

children.name: MaxRegenPower
children.description: Peak regen/brake power, in kilowatts, that motor(s) can generate.

children.name: MaxRegenTorque
children.description: Peak regen/brake torque, in newton meter, that the motor(s) can generate.

children.name: Speed
children.description: Motor rotational speed measured as rotations per minute. Negative values indicate reverse driving mode.

children.name: TimeInUse
children.description: Accumulated time during engine lifetime when the vehicule state's is 'READY'.
children.comment: Vehicles may define their READY state.

children.name: Temperature
children.description: Motor temperature.

children.name: CoolantTemperature
children.description: Motor coolant temperature (if applicable).

children.name: Power
children.description: Current motor power output. Negative values indicate regen mode.

children.name: Torque
children.description: Current motor torque. Negative values indicate regen mode.

children.name: Average
children.description: Current average temperature of the battery cells.

children.name: Min
children.description: Current minimum temperature of the battery cells, i.e. temperature of the coldest cell.

children.name: Max
children.description: Current maximum temperature of the battery cells, i.e. temperature of the hottest cell.

children.name: CellTemperature
children.description: Array of cell temperatures. Length or array shall correspond to number of cells in vehicle.
children.comment: Cells are identified by relative position in array.

children.name: Min
children.description: Current voltage of the battery cell with lowest voltage.

children.name: IdMin
children.description: Identifier of the battery cell with lowest voltage.
children.comment: Identifier is supposed to be relative index of the cell, starting with 0 the first cell.

children.name: Max
children.description: Current voltage of the battery cell with highest voltage.

children.name: IdMax
children.description: Identifier of the battery cell with highest voltage.
children.comment: Identifier is supposed to be relative index of the cell, starting with 0 the first cell.

children.name: CellVoltages
children.description: Array of cell voltages. Length or array shall correspond to number of cells in vehicle.
children.comment: Cells are identified by relative position in array.

children.name: Current
children.description: Physical state of charge of the high voltage battery, relative to net capacity. This is not necessarily the state of charge being displayed to the customer.

children.name: Displayed
children.description: State of charge displayed to the customer.

children.name: CurrentEnergy
children.description: Physical state of charge of high voltage battery expressed in kWh.
children.comment: Current energy could be calculated as .StateOfCharge.Current * .NetCapacity.

children.name: IsFlapOpen
children.description: Status of the charging port flap(s).
children.comment: True = at least one flap of this port is open, False = All flaps of this port are closed.

children.name: IsChargingCableLocked
children.description: Is charging cable locked to prevent removal.
children.comment: Locking of charging cable can be used to prevent unintentional removing during charging.

children.name: SupportedInletTypes
children.description: A list of the supported (i.e., available) charging inlets in a particular charging port. IEC types refer to IEC 62196,  GBT refers to  GB/T 20234.
children.comment: A vehicle may have multiple charging ports. IEC_TYPE_1_AC refers to Type 1 as defined in IEC 62196-2. Also known as Yazaki or J1772 connector. IEC_TYPE_2_AC refers to Type 2 as defined in IEC 62196-2. Also known as Mennekes connector. IEC_TYPE_3_AC refers to Type 3 as defined in IEC 62196-2. Also known as Scame connector. IEC_TYPE_4_DC refers to AA configuration as defined in IEC 62196-3. Also known as Type 4 or CHAdeMO connector. IEC_TYPE_1_CCS_DC refers to EE Configuration as defined in IEC 62196-3. Also known as CCS1 or Combo1 connector. IEC_TYPE_2_CCS_DC refers to FF Configuration as defined in IEC 62196-3. Also known as CCS2 or Combo2 connector. TESLA_ROADSTER, TESLA_HPWC (High Power Wall Connector) and TESLA_SUPERCHARGER refer to non-standardized charging ports/methods used by Tesla. GBT_AC refers to connector specified in GB/T 20234.2. GBT_DC refers to connector specified in GB/T 20234.3. Also specified as BB Configuration in IEC 62196-3. OTHER shall be used for charging ports not included in the list above. For additional information see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEC_62196.

children.comment: True = at least one flap of this port is open, False = All flaps of this port are closed.

children.comment: Locking of charging cable can be used to prevent unintentional removing during charging.

children.name: IsChargingCableConnected
children.description: Indicates whether a charging cable is physically connected to a particular charging port or not.

children.name: DC
children.description: Maximum DC charging current at inlet that can be accepted by the system.

children.name: Phase1
children.description: Maximum AC charging current (rms) at inlet for Phase 1 that can be accepted by the system.

children.name: Phase2
children.description: Maximum AC charging current (rms) at inlet for Phase 2 that can be accepted by the system.

children.name: Phase3
children.description: Maximum AC charging current (rms) at inlet for Phase 3 that can be accepted by the system.

children.name: DC
children.description: Current DC charging current at inlet. Negative if returning energy to grid.

children.name: Phase1
children.description: Current AC charging current (rms) at inlet for Phase 1. Negative if returning energy to grid.

children.name: Phase2
children.description: Current AC charging current (rms) at inlet for Phase 2. Negative if returning energy to grid.

children.name: Phase3
children.description: Current AC charging current (rms) at inlet for Phase 3. Negative if returning energy to grid.

children.name: DC
children.description: Current DC charging voltage at charging inlet.

children.name: Phase1
children.description: Current AC charging voltage (rms) at inlet for Phase 1.

children.name: Phase2
children.description: Current AC charging voltage (rms) at inlet for Phase 2.

children.name: Phase3
children.description: Current AC charging voltage (rms) at inlet for Phase 3.

children.name: Latitude
children.description: Latitude of last or current charging event in WGS 84 geodetic coordinates.

children.name: Longitude
children.description: Longitude of last or current charging event in WGS 84 geodetic coordinates.

children.name: Altitude
children.description: Altitude relative to WGS 84 reference ellipsoid of last or current charging event.

children.name: Mode
children.description: Defines timer mode for charging: INACTIVE - no timer set, charging may start as soon as battery is connected to a charger. START_TIME - charging shall start at Charging.Timer.Time. END_TIME - charging shall be finished (reach Charging.ChargeLimit) at Charging.Timer.Time. When charging is completed the vehicle shall change mode to 'inactive' or set a new Charging.Timer.Time. Charging shall start immediately if mode is 'starttime' or 'endtime' and Charging.Timer.Time is a time in the past.

children.name: Time
children.description: Time for next charging-related action, formatted according to ISO 8601 with UTC time zone. Value has no significance if Charging.Timer.Mode is 'inactive'.

children.name: ChargeLimit
children.description: Target charge limit (state of charge) for battery.

children.name: StartStopCharging
children.description: Start or stop the charging process.

children.name: IsCharging
children.description: True if charging is ongoing. Charging is considered to be ongoing if energy is flowing from charger to vehicle.

children.name: IsDischarging
children.description: True if discharging (vehicle to grid) is ongoing. Discharging is considered to be ongoing if energy is flowing from vehicle to charger/grid.

children.name: AveragePower
children.description: Average charging power of last or current charging event.

children.name: MaxPower
children.description: Maximum charging power of last or current charging event.

children.name: EvseId
children.description: EVSE charging point ID (without separators) of last or current charging event according to ISO 15118-2 Annex H.
children.comment: Length of id between 7 and 37 characters. ZZ00000 to be used if SECC cannot provide id

children.name: PowerLoss
children.description: Electrical energy lost by power dissipation to heat inside the AC/DC converter.

children.name: Temperature
children.description: Current temperature of AC/DC converter converting grid voltage to battery voltage.

children.name: ChargeRate
children.description: Current charging rate, as in kilometers of range added per hour.

children.name: TimeToComplete
children.description: The time needed for the current charging process to reach Charging.ChargeLimit. 0 if charging is complete or no charging process is active or planned.
children.comment: Shall consider time set by Charging.Timer.Time. E.g. if charging shall start in 3 hours and 2 hours of charging is needed, then Charging.TimeToComplete shall report 5 hours.

children.name: PowerLoss
children.description: Electrical energy lost by power dissipation to heat inside DC/DC converter.

children.name: Temperature
children.description: Current temperature of DC/DC converter converting battery high voltage to vehicle low voltage (typically 12 Volts).

children.name: RequestedMode
children.description: Defines requested mode for battery conditioning. INACTIVE - Battery conditioning inactive. FAST_CHARGING_PREPARATION - Battery conditioning for fast charging. DRIVING_PREPARATION - Battery conditioning for driving.
children.comment: The Mode and TargetTime can be used to calculate TargetTemperature and StartTime

children.name: StartTime
children.description: Start time for battery conditioning, formatted according to ISO 8601 with UTC time zone.
children.comment: If the vehicle is asleep, this is the time the vehicle and the battery conditioning system must wake up and start monitoring the battery and if necessary start heating/cooling of the battery.

children.name: TargetTime
children.description: Target time when conditioning shall be finished, formatted according to ISO 8601 with UTC time zone.
children.comment: For FAST_CHARGING mode this is typically the time when charging is supposed to start. For DRIVING mode this is typically the expected departure time. Battery conditioning will be deactivated when this time has passed.

children.name: TargetTemperature
children.description: Target temperature for battery conditioning.
children.comment: Target temperature possibly differs between different modes as well as other factors. Allowed deviation from target temperature is implementation dependent.

children.name: IsActive
children.description: Indicates if battery conditioning is active (i.e. actively monitors battery temperature). True = Active. False = Inactive.
children.comment: This signal is typically true when mode is not INACTIVE and time is within defined start/end times.

children.name: IsOngoing
children.description: Indicating if battery conditioning is currently ongoing. Battery conditioning is considered ongoing when the battery conditioning system is actively heating or cooling the battery, or requesting heating or cooling.
children.comment: When battery conditioning is active, but temperature is already within acceptable range so that no cooling or heating is needed then IsOngoing shall report False.

children.name: Id
children.description: Battery Identification Number as assigned by OEM.
children.comment: This could be serial number, part number plus serial number, UUID, or any other identifier that the OEM want to use to uniquely identify the battery individual.

children.name: ProductionDate
children.description: Production date of battery in ISO8601 format, e.g. YYYY-MM-DD.

children.name: GrossCapacity
children.description: Gross capacity of the battery.

children.name: NominalVoltage
children.description: Nominal Voltage of the battery.
children.comment: Nominal voltage typically refers to voltage of fully charged battery when delivering rated capacity.

children.name: MaxVoltage
children.description: Max allowed voltage of the battery, e.g. during charging.

children.name: ErrorCodes
children.description: Current error codes related to the battery, if any.
children.comment: Error code format is not defined, it may be DTCs according to OBD II (SAE-J2012DA_201812) standard ([P|C|B|U]XXXXX ) or any other format.

children.name: IsPowerConnected
children.description: Indicating if the power (positive terminator) of the traction battery is connected to the powertrain.
children.comment: It might be possible to disconnect the traction battery used by an electric powertrain. This is achieved by connectors, typically one for plus and one for minus.

children.name: IsGroundConnected
children.description: Indicating if the ground (negative terminator) of the traction battery is connected to the powertrain.
children.comment: It might be possible to disconnect the traction battery used by an electric powertrain. This is achieved by connectors, typically one for plus and one for minus.

children.name: NetCapacity
children.description: Total net capacity of the battery considering aging.

children.name: StateOfHealth
children.description: Calculated battery state of health at standard conditions.
children.comment: Exact formula is implementation dependent. Could be e.g. current capacity at 20 degrees Celsius divided with original capacity at the same temperature.

children.name: CurrentVoltage
children.description: Current Voltage of the battery.

children.name: CurrentCurrent
children.description: Current current flowing in/out of battery. Positive = Current flowing in to battery, e.g. during charging. Negative = Current flowing out of battery, e.g. during driving.

children.name: CurrentPower
children.description: Current electrical energy flowing in/out of battery. Positive = Energy flowing in to battery, e.g. during charging. Negative = Energy flowing out of battery, e.g. during driving.

children.name: AccumulatedChargedEnergy
children.description: The accumulated energy delivered to the battery during charging over lifetime of the battery.

children.name: AccumulatedConsumedEnergy
children.description: The accumulated energy leaving HV battery for propulsion and auxiliary loads over lifetime of the battery.

children.name: AccumulatedChargedThroughput
children.description: The accumulated charge throughput delivered to the battery during charging over lifetime of the battery.

children.name: AccumulatedConsumedThroughput
children.description: The accumulated charge throughput leaving HV battery for propulsion and auxiliary loads over lifetime of the battery.

children.name: PowerLoss
children.description: Electrical energy lost by power dissipation to heat inside the battery.

children.name: Range
children.description: Remaining range in meters using only battery.

children.name: TimeRemaining
children.description: Time remaining in seconds before the battery is empty.

children.name: IsFuelPortFlapOpen
children.description: Status of the fuel port flap(s). True if at least one is open.

children.name: SupportedFuelTypes
children.description: High level information of fuel types supported
children.comment: If a vehicle also has an electric drivetrain (e.g. hybrid) that will be obvious from the PowerTrain.Type signal.

children.name: SupportedFuel
children.description: Detailed information on fuels supported by the vehicle. Identifiers originating from DIN EN 16942:2021-08, appendix B, with additional suffix for octane (RON) where relevant.
children.comment: RON 95 is sometimes referred to as Super, RON 98 as Super Plus.

children.name: HybridType
children.description: Defines the hybrid type of the vehicle.

children.name: TankCapacity
children.description: Capacity of the fuel tank in liters.

children.name: RefuelPortPosition
children.description: Position of refuel port(s). First part indicates side of vehicle, second part relative position on that side.

children.name: AbsoluteLevel
children.description: Current available fuel in the fuel tank expressed in liters.

children.name: RelativeLevel
children.description: Level in fuel tank as percent of capacity. 0 = empty. 100 = full.

children.name: Range
children.description: Remaining range in meters using only liquid fuel.

children.name: TimeRemaining
children.description: Time remaining in seconds before the fuel tank is empty.

children.name: InstantConsumption
children.description: Current consumption in liters per 100 km.

children.name: AverageConsumption
children.description: Average consumption in liters per 100 km.

children.name: ConsumptionSinceStart
children.description: Fuel amount in liters consumed since start of current trip.
children.comment: A new trip is considered to start when engine gets enabled (e.g. LowVoltageSystemState in ON or START mode). A trip is considered to end when engine is no longer enabled. The signal may however keep the value of the last trip until a new trip is started.

children.name: ConsumptionSinceLastRefuel
children.description: Fuel consumption since last refueling.
children.comment: Amount of fuel consumed since last refueling.

children.name: IsEngineStopStartEnabled
children.description: Indicates whether eco start stop is currently enabled.

children.name: IsFuelLevelLow
children.description: Indicates that the fuel level is low (e.g. <50km range).

children.name: PowerOptimizeLevel
children.description: Power optimization level for this branch/subsystem. A higher number indicates more aggressive power optimization. Level 0 indicates that all functionality is enabled, no power optimization enabled. Level 10 indicates most aggressive power optimization mode, only essential functionality enabled.

children.name: IsAutoPowerOptimize
children.description: Auto Power Optimization Flag When set to 'true', the system enables automatic power optimization, dynamically adjusting the power optimization level based on runtime conditions or features managed by the OEM. When set to 'false', manual control of the power optimization level is allowed.

children.name: Type
children.description: Defines the powertrain type of the vehicle.
children.comment: For vehicles with a combustion engine (including hybrids) more detailed information on fuels supported can be found in FuelSystem.SupportedFuelTypes and FuelSystem.SupportedFuels.

children.name: AccumulatedBrakingEnergy
children.description: The accumulated energy from regenerative braking over lifetime.

children.name: Range
children.description: Remaining range in meters using all energy sources available in the vehicle.

children.name: TimeRemaining
children.description: Time remaining in seconds before all energy sources available in the vehicle are empty.

children.name: IsOpen
children.description: Is item open or closed? True = Fully or partially open. False = Fully closed.

children.name: Position
children.description: Item position. 0 = Start position 100 = End position.
children.comment: Relationship between Open/Close and Start/End position is item dependent.

children.name: Switch
children.description: Switch controlling sliding action such as window, sunroof, or blind.

children.name: IsLightOn
children.description: Is trunk light on
children.comment: V4.0 Moved from Vehicle.Cabin.Lights.IsTrunkOn because Trunk is not defined as part of the Cabin.

children.name: IsLocked
children.description: Is item locked or unlocked. True = Locked. False = Unlocked.

children.name: IsOpen
children.description: Is item open or closed? True = Fully or partially open. False = Fully closed.

children.name: Position
children.description: Item position. 0 = Start position 100 = End position.
children.comment: Relationship between Open/Close and Start/End position is item dependent.

children.name: Switch
children.description: Switch controlling sliding action such as window, sunroof, or blind.

children.name: IsLightOn
children.description: Is trunk light on
children.comment: V4.0 Moved from Vehicle.Cabin.Lights.IsTrunkOn because Trunk is not defined as part of the Cabin.

children.name: IsLocked
children.description: Is item locked or unlocked. True = Locked. False = Unlocked.

children.name: IsOpen
children.description: Is item open or closed? True = Fully or partially open. False = Fully closed.

children.name: Position
children.description: Item position. 0 = Start position 100 = End position.
children.comment: Relationship between Open/Close and Start/End position is item dependent.

children.name: Switch
children.description: Switch controlling sliding action such as window, sunroof, or blind.

children.name: IsActive
children.description: Horn active or inactive. True = Active. False = Inactive.

children.name: Intensity
children.description: Rain intensity. 0 = Dry, No Rain. 100 = Covered.

children.name: Mode
children.description: Requested mode of wiper system. STOP_HOLD means that the wipers shall move to position given by TargetPosition and then hold the position. WIPE means that wipers shall move to the position given by TargetPosition and then hold the position if no new TargetPosition is requested. PLANT_MODE means that wiping is disabled. Exact behavior is vehicle specific. EMERGENCY_STOP means that wiping shall be immediately stopped without holding the position.

children.name: Frequency
children.description: Wiping frequency/speed, measured in cycles per minute. The signal concerns the actual speed of the wiper blades when moving. Intervals/pauses are excluded, i.e. the value corresponds to the number of cycles that would be completed in 1 minute if wiping permanently over default range.
children.comment: Examples - 0 = Wipers stopped, 80 = Wipers doing 80 cycles per minute (in WIPE mode).

children.name: TargetPosition
children.description: Requested position of main wiper blade for the wiper system relative to reference position. Location of reference position (0 degrees) and direction of positive/negative degrees is vehicle specific. System behavior when receiving TargetPosition depends on Mode and IsEndingWipeCycle. Supported values are vehicle specific and might be dynamically corrected. If IsEndingWipeCycle=True then wipers will complete current movement before actuating new TargetPosition. If IsEndingWipeCycle=False then wipers will directly change destination if the TargetPosition is changed.
children.comment: Default parking position might be used as reference position.

children.name: ActualPosition
children.description: Actual position of main wiper blade for the wiper system relative to reference position. Location of reference position (0 degrees) and direction of positive/negative degrees is vehicle specific.
children.comment: Default parking position might be used as reference position.

children.name: DriveCurrent
children.description: Actual current used by wiper drive.
children.comment: May be negative in special situations.

children.name: IsWiping
children.description: Indicates wiper movement. True if wiper blades are moving. Change of direction shall be considered as IsWiping if wipers will continue to move directly after the change of direction.

children.name: IsEndingWipeCycle
children.description: Indicates if current wipe movement is completed or near completion. True = Movement is completed or near completion. Changes to RequestedPosition will be executed first after reaching previous RequestedPosition, if it has not already been reached. False = Movement is not near completion. Any change to RequestedPosition will be executed immediately. Change of direction may not be allowed.
children.comment: In continuous wiping between A and B this sensor can be used a trigger to update TargetPosition.

children.name: IsWiperError
children.description: Indicates system failure. True if wiping is disabled due to system failure.

children.name: IsPositionReached
children.description: Indicates if a requested position has been reached. IsPositionReached refers to the previous position in case the TargetPosition is updated while IsEndingWipeCycle=True. True = Current or Previous TargetPosition reached. False = Position not (yet) reached, or wipers have moved away from the reached position.

children.name: IsBlocked
children.description: Indicates if wiper movement is blocked. True = Movement blocked. False = Movement not blocked.

children.name: IsOverheated
children.description: Indicates if wiper system is overheated. True = Wiper system overheated. False = Wiper system not overheated.

children.name: Mode
children.description: Wiper mode requested by user/driver. INTERVAL indicates intermittent wiping, with fixed time interval between each wipe. RAIN_SENSOR indicates intermittent wiping based on rain intensity.

children.name: Intensity
children.description: Relative intensity/sensitivity for interval and rain sensor mode as requested by user/driver. Has no significance if Windshield.Wiping.Mode is OFF/SLOW/MEDIUM/FAST 0 - wipers inactive. 1 - minimum intensity (lowest frequency/sensitivity, longest interval). 2/3/4/... - higher intensity (higher frequency/sensitivity, shorter interval). Maximum value supported is vehicle specific.

children.name: WiperWear
children.description: Wiper wear as percent. 0 = No Wear. 100 = Worn. Replacement required. Method for calculating or estimating wiper wear is vehicle specific. For windshields with multiple wipers the wear reported shall correspond to the most worn wiper.

children.name: IsWipersWorn
children.description: Wiper wear status. True = Worn, Replacement recommended or required. False = Not Worn.

children.name: IsLevelLow
children.description: Low level indication for washer fluid. True = Level Low. False = Level OK.

children.name: Level
children.description: Washer fluid level as a percent. 0 = Empty. 100 = Full.

children.name: IsHeatingOn
children.description: Windshield heater status. False - off, True - on.

children.name: LightSwitch
children.description: Status of the vehicle main light switch.
children.comment: A vehicle typically does not support all alternatives. Which lights that actually are lit may vary according to vehicle configuration and local legislation. OFF is typically indicated by 0. POSITION is typically indicated by ISO 7000 symbol 0456. DAYTIME_RUNNING_LIGHTS (DRL) can be indicated by ISO 7000 symbol 2611. AUTO indicates that vehicle automatically selects suitable lights. BEAM is typically indicated by ISO 7000 symbol 0083.

children.name: IsHighBeamSwitchOn
children.description: Status of the high beam switch. True = high beam enabled. False = high beam not enabled.
children.comment: This signal indicates the status of the switch and does not indicate if low or high beam actually are on. That typically depends on vehicle logic and other signals like Lights.LightSwitch and Vehicle.LowVoltageSystemState.

children.name: Tilt
children.description: Mirror tilt as a percent. 0 = Center Position. 100 = Fully Upward Position. -100 = Fully Downward Position.

children.name: Pan

children.name: IsHeatingOn

children.name: PlaybackRate

children.comment: The normal playback rate is multiplied by this value to obtain the current rate, so a value of 1.0 indicates normal speed. Values of lower than 1.0 make the media play slower than normal. Values of higher than 1.0 make the media play faster than normal.

children.name: Genre

children.comment: If true, then auto-scaling mode is used. If false, then manual-scaling mode is used.

children.name: Mute

children.name: Volume
children.description: Current navigation volume

children.name: GuidanceVoice
children.description: Navigation guidance state that was selected.
children.comment: ETC indicates a voice alternative not covered by the explicitly listed alternatives.

children.name: IsScreenAlwaysOn
children.description: Used to prevent the screen going black if no action placed.

children.name: DisplayOffDuration
children.description: Duration in seconds before the display is turned off. Value shall be 0 if screen never shall turn off.
children.comment: Display shall be turned off at HMI.LastActionTime + HMI.DisplayOffDuration, unless HMI.IsScreenAlwaysOn==True.

children.name: CurrentLanguage
children.description: ISO 639-1 standard language code for the current HMI

children.name: LastActionTime
children.description: Time for last hmi action, formatted according to ISO 8601 with UTC time zone.

children.name: Active
children.description: Projection activation info.
children.comment: NONE indicates that projection is not supported.

children.name: Source
children.description: Connectivity source selected for projection.
children.comment: Smartphone projection exposes or controls specific applications on the Smartphone on the vehicle infotainment system.

children.name: SupportedMode
children.description: Supportable list for projection.

children.name: Active
children.description: Mirroring activation info.
children.comment: NONE indicates that mirroring is not supported.

children.name: Source
children.description: Connectivity source selected for mirroring.

children.name: PowerOptimizeLevel
children.description: Power optimization level for this branch/subsystem. A higher number indicates more aggressive power optimization. Level 0 indicates that all functionality is enabled, no power optimization enabled. Level 10 indicates most aggressive power optimization mode, only essential functionality enabled.

children.name: IsAutoPowerOptimize
children.description: Auto Power Optimization Flag When set to 'true', the system enables automatic power optimization, dynamically adjusting the power optimization level based on runtime conditions or features managed by the OEM. When set to 'false', manual control of the power optimization level is allowed.

children.name: IsOpen
children.description: Is item open or closed? True = Fully or partially open. False = Fully closed.

children.name: Position
children.description: Item position. 0 = Start position 100 = End position.
children.comment: Relationship between Open/Close and Start/End position is item dependent.

children.name: Switch
children.description: Switch controlling sliding action such as window, sunroof, or blind.

children.name: Switch
children.description: Switch controlling sliding action such as window, sunroof, or shade.

children.name: Position
children.description: Sunroof position. 0 = Fully closed 100 = Fully opened. -100 = Fully tilted.

children.name: DimmingLevel
children.description: Dimming level of rear-view mirror. 0 = Undimmed. 100 = Fully dimmed.

children.name: IsLightOn
children.description: Indicates whether the light is turned on. True = On, False = Off.

children.name: Intensity
children.description: How much of the maximum possible brightness of the light is used. 1 = Maximum attenuation, 100 = No attenuation (i.e. full brightness).
children.comment: Minimum value cannot be zero as on/off is controlled by the actuator IsLightOn. V4.0 moved from Cabin.Lights.AmbientLight.Intensity to enable individual control of lights via the SingleConfigurableLight.vspec.

children.name: Color
children.description: Hexadecimal color code represented as a 3-byte RGB (i.e. Red, Green, and Blue) value preceded by a hash symbol "#". Allowed range "#000000" to "#FFFFFF".
children.comment: For example; "#C0C0C0" = Silver, "#FFD700" = Gold, "#000000" = Black, "#FFFFFF" = White, etc.

children.name: PerceivedAmbientLight
children.description: The percentage of ambient light that is measured (e.g., by a sensor) inside the cabin. 0 = No ambient light. 100 = Full brightness.
children.comment: V4.0 named changed from "AmbientLight" to "PerceivedAmbientLight". This is a read-only property that refers to the pre-existing light (e.g., natural light). If you are looking for the in-cabin decorative lights that sometimes are also called "AmbientLights", please refer to the branch Vehicle.Cabin.Light.AmbientLight.

children.name: Subject
children.description: Subject for the authentication of the occupant e.g. UserID 7331677.

children.name: Issuer
children.description: Unique Issuer for the authentication of the occupant e.g. https://accounts.funcorp.com.

children.name: Support
children.description: Lumbar support (in/out position). 0 = Innermost position. 100 = Outermost position.

children.name: Height
children.description: Height of lumbar support. Position is relative within available movable range of the lumbar support. 0 = Lowermost position supported.

children.name: Support
children.description: Side bolster support. 0 = Minimum support (widest side bolster setting). 100 = Maximum support.

children.name: Recline
children.description: Backrest recline compared to seat z-axis (seat vertical axis). 0 degrees = Upright/Vertical backrest. Negative degrees for forward recline. Positive degrees for backward recline.
children.comment: Seat z-axis depends on seat tilt. This means that movement of backrest due to seat tilting will not affect Backrest.Recline as long as the angle between Seating and Backrest are constant. Absolute recline relative to vehicle z-axis can be calculated as Tilt + Backrest.Recline.

children.name: LumbarSupport
children.description: Lumbar support (in/out position). 0 = Innermost position. 100 = Outermost position.

children.name: LumbarHeight
children.description: Height of lumbar support. Position is relative within available movable range of the lumbar support. 0 = Lowermost position supported.

children.name: SideBolsterSupport
children.description: Side bolster support. 0 = Minimum support (widest side bolster setting). 100 = Maximum support.

children.name: Tilt
children.description: Tilting of seat (seating and backrest) relative to vehicle x-axis. 0 = seat bottom is flat, seat bottom and vehicle x-axis are parallel. Positive degrees = seat tilted backwards, seat x-axis tilted upward, seat z-axis is tilted backward.
children.comment: In VSS it is assumed that tilting a seat affects both seating (seat bottom) and backrest, i.e. the angle between seating and backrest will not be affected when changing Tilt.

children.comment: In VSS it is assumed that tilting a seat affects both seating (seat bottom) and backrest, i.e. the angle between seating and backrest will not be affected when changing Tilt.

children.name: Support
children.description: Lumbar support (in/out position). 0 = Innermost position. 100 = Outermost position.

children.name: Height
children.description: Height of lumbar support. Position is relative within available movable range of the lumbar support. 0 = Lowermost position supported.

children.name: Support
children.description: Side bolster support. 0 = Minimum support (widest side bolster setting). 100 = Maximum support.

children.name: Recline
children.description: Backrest recline compared to seat z-axis (seat vertical axis). 0 degrees = Upright/Vertical backrest. Negative degrees for forward recline. Positive degrees for backward recline.
children.comment: Seat z-axis depends on seat tilt. This means that movement of backrest due to seat tilting will not affect Backrest.Recline as long as the angle between Seating and Backrest are constant. Absolute recline relative to vehicle z-axis can be calculated as Tilt + Backrest.Recline.

children.description: Is the belt engaged.

children.name: Status
children.description: Roof status on convertible vehicles.

children.name: IsWindowChildLockEngaged
children.description: Is window child lock engaged. True = Engaged. False = Disengaged.
children.comment: Window child lock refers to the functionality to disable the move window button next to most windows, so that they only can be operated by the driver.

children.name: PowerOptimizeLevel
children.description: Power optimization level for this branch/subsystem. A higher number indicates more aggressive power optimization. Level 0 indicates that all functionality is enabled, no power optimization enabled. Level 10 indicates most aggressive power optimization mode, only essential functionality enabled.

children.name: IsAutoPowerOptimize
children.description: Auto Power Optimization Flag When set to 'true', the system enables automatic power optimization, dynamically adjusting the power optimization level based on runtime conditions or features managed by the OEM. When set to 'false', manual control of the power optimization level is allowed.

children.name: DoorCount
children.description: Number of doors in vehicle.

children.name: DriverPosition
children.description: The position of the driver seat in row 1.
children.comment: Some signals use DriverSide and PassengerSide as instances. If this signal specifies that DriverPosition is LEFT or MIDDLE, then DriverSide refers to left side and PassengerSide to right side. If this signal specifies that DriverPosition is RIGHT, then DriverSide refers to right side and PassengerSide to left side.

children.name: SeatRowCount
children.description: Number of seat rows in vehicle.
children.comment: Default value corresponds to two rows of seats.

children.name: SeatPosCount
children.description: Number of seats across each row from the front to the rear.
children.comment: Default value corresponds to two seats in front row and 3 seats in second row.

children.name: IsEnabled
children.description: Indicates if cruise control system is enabled (e.g. ready to receive configurations and settings) True = Enabled. False = Disabled.

children.name: IsActive
children.description: Indicates if cruise control system is active (i.e. actively controls speed). True = Active. False = Inactive.

children.name: SpeedSet
children.description: Set cruise control speed in kilometers per hour.

children.name: IsAdaptive
children.description: Indicates if cruise control system is adaptive (i.e. actively controls speed).

children.name: AdaptiveDistanceSet
children.description: Distance in meters to keep from lead vehicle

children.name: AdaptiveIntervalSet
children.description: Follow distance setting, commonly 1-5 with 1 being closest.

children.name: IsError
children.description: Indicates if cruise control system incurred an error condition. True = Error. False = No Error.

children.name: IsEnabled
children.description: Indicates if lane departure detection system is enabled. True = Enabled. False = Disabled.

children.name: IsWarning
children.description: Indicates if lane departure detection registered a lane departure.

children.name: IsError
children.description: Indicates if lane departure system incurred an error condition. True = Error. False = No Error.

children.name: IsEnabled
children.description: Indicates if obstacle sensor system is enabled (i.e. monitoring for obstacles). True = Enabled. False = Disabled.

children.name: IsWarning
children.description: Indicates if obstacle sensor system registered an obstacle.

children.name: IsError
children.description: Indicates if obstacle sensor system incurred an error condition. True = Error. False = No Error.

children.name: Distance
children.description: Distance in meters to detected object

children.name: TimeGap
children.description: Time in milliseconds before potential impact object

children.name: WarningType
children.description: Indicates the type of obstacle warning detected as some track not only the presence of an obstacle but potential intercepting trajectory or other characteristics.
children.comment: Undefined obstacle warning type would merely alert of presence of obstacle and may measure distance.

children.name: IsEnabled
children.description: Indicates if obstacle sensor system is enabled (i.e. monitoring for obstacles). True = Enabled. False = Disabled.

children.name: PowerOptimizeLevel
children.description: Power optimization level for this branch/subsystem. A higher number indicates more aggressive power optimization. Level 0 indicates that all functionality is enabled, no power optimization enabled. Level 10 indicates most aggressive power optimization mode, only essential functionality enabled.

children.name: IsAutoPowerOptimize
children.description: Auto Power Optimization Flag When set to 'true', the system enables automatic power optimization, dynamically adjusting the power optimization level based on runtime conditions or features managed by the OEM. When set to 'false', manual control of the power optimization level is allowed.

children.name: SupportedAutonomyLevel
children.description: Indicates the highest level of driving automation according to the SAE J3016 taxonomy the vehicle is capable of.

children.name: ActiveAutonomyLevel
children.description: Indicates the currently active level of driving automation according to the SAE J3016 (Taxonomy and Definitions for Terms Related to Driving Automation Systems for On-Road Motor Vehicles).
children.comment: Complies with https://www.sae.org/standards/content/j3016_202104/ and https://www.sae.org/blog/sae-j3016-update. Level 5 and 4 ADS (Automated driving system) disengage, if appropriate, only after it achieves a minimal risk condition or a driver is performing the DDT. Level 3 ADS disengages either an appropriate time after issuing a request to intervene or immediately upon user request. Level 2 DAS (Driving automation system) disengages immediately upon driver request. However, since many Level 2 DAS, often termed "Level 2.5", warn the driver shortly before reaching their operational limits, the VSS also supports the DISENGAGING state for SAE_2. Nevertheless, it should be noted that the SAE J3016 states that it is incorrect to describe driving automation features using fractional levels.

children.name: X
children.description: Longitudinal position of head center measured as mid eye position on X-axis of the vehicle rear-axle coordinate system as defined by ISO 23150:2023 section 3.7.12 Mid eye position refers to the center of a line drawn between the center of the drivers eyes. Positive values = forward of (first) rear-axle. Negative values = backward of (first) rear-axle.

children.name: Y
children.description: Lateral position of head center measured as mid eye position on X-axis of the vehicle rear-axle coordinate system as defined by ISO 23150:2023 section 3.7.12 Mid eye position refers to the center of a line drawn between the center of the drivers eyes. Positive values = left of rear-axle center. Negative values = right of rear-axle center.

children.name: Z
children.description: Height position of head center measured as mid eye position on X-axis of the vehicle rear-axle coordinate system as defined by ISO 23150:2023 section 3.7.12 Mid eye position refers to the center of a line drawn between the center of the drivers eyes. Positive values = above center of rear-axle reference point. Negative values = below center of rear-axle reference point.

children.name: Yaw
children.description: Head yaw angle, measured from the vehicle sprung mass X-axis as defined by ISO 23150:2023 to the head X-axis, around the vehicle Z-axis (right-hand rule). 0 = Head in normal position. Positive values = Head turned left. Negative values = Head turned right.

children.name: Pitch
children.description: Head pitch angle, measured as angle from vehicle sprung mass XY-plane as defined by ISO 23150:2023 to the head X-axis. 0 = Head in normal position. Positive values = Head leaning up. Negative values = Head leaning down.

children.name: Roll
children.description: Head roll angle about the head X-axis (right-hand rule). 0 = Head in normal position. Positive values = Head leaning to the right. Negative values = Head leaning to the left.

children.name: Azimuth
children.description: Mid eye azimuth gaze (right-hand rule) on vehicle sprung mass Z-axis as defined by ISO 23150:2023 0 = Driver looking forward. Positive values = Driver looking at something on the left side of driver. Negative values = Driver looking at something on the right side of driver.

children.name: Elevation
children.description: Elevation to observed object measured as angle between vehicle sprung mass XY-plane as defined by ISO 23150:2023 at driver mid eye position and object. 0 = Driver looking at something at same height as mid eye position. Positive values = Driver looking at something above mid eye position. Negative values = Driver looking at something below mid eye position.

children.name: AirTemperature
children.description: Air temperature outside the vehicle.

children.name: Humidity
children.description: Relative humidity outside the vehicle. 0 = Dry, 100 = Air fully saturated.

children.name: LightIntensity
children.description: Light intensity outside the vehicle. 0 = No light detected, 100 = Fully lit.
children.comment: Mapping to physical units and calculation method is sensor specific.

children.name: IsServiceDue
children.description: Indicates if vehicle needs service (of any kind). True = Service needed now or in the near future. False = No known need for service.

children.name: DistanceToService
children.description: Remaining distance to service (of any kind). Negative values indicate service overdue.

children.name: TimeToService
children.description: Remaining time to service (of any kind). Negative values indicate service overdue.

children.name: IsConnectivityAvailable
children.description: Indicates if connectivity between vehicle and cloud is available. True = Connectivity is available. False = Connectivity is not available.
children.comment: This signal can be used by onboard vehicle services to decide what features that shall be offered to the driver, for example disable the 'check for update' button if vehicle does not have connectivity.

children.name: Major
children.description: Supported Version of VSS - Major version.

children.name: Minor
children.description: Supported Version of VSS - Minor version.

children.name: Patch
children.description: Supported Version of VSS - Patch version.

children.name: Label
children.description: Label to further describe the version.
children.comment: COVESA VSS project typically use dev for latest master, and empty string for released versions.

children.name: VIN
children.description: 17-character Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) as defined by ISO 3779.

children.name: WMI
children.description: 3-character World Manufacturer Identification (WMI) as defined by ISO 3780.

children.name: Brand
children.description: Vehicle brand or manufacturer.

children.name: Model
children.description: Vehicle model.

children.name: Year
children.description: Model year of the vehicle.

children.name: AcrissCode
children.description: The ACRISS Car Classification Code is a code used by many car rental companies.

children.name: BodyType
children.description: Indicates the design and body style of the vehicle (e.g. station wagon, hatchback, etc.).

children.name: DateVehicleFirstRegistered
children.description: The date in ISO 8601 format of the first registration of the vehicle with the respective public authorities.

children.name: LicensePlate
children.description: The license plate of the vehicle.
children.comment: Depending on the context, this attribute might not be up to date or might be misconfigured, and therefore should be considered untrustworthy in the absence of another method of verification.

children.name: MeetsEmissionStandard
children.description: Indicates that the vehicle meets the respective emission standard.

children.name: ProductionDate
children.description: The date in ISO 8601 format of production of the item, e.g. vehicle.

children.name: PurchaseDate
children.description: The date in ISO 8601 format of the item e.g. vehicle was purchased by the current owner.

children.name: VehicleModelDate
children.description: The release date in ISO 8601 format of a vehicle model (often used to differentiate versions of the same make and model).

children.name: VehicleConfiguration
children.description: A short text indicating the configuration of the vehicle, e.g. '5dr hatchback ST 2.5 MT 225 hp' or 'limited edition'.

children.name: VehicleSeatingCapacity
children.description: The number of passengers that can be seated in the vehicle, both in terms of the physical space available, and in terms of limitations set by law.

children.name: VehicleSpecialUsage
children.description: Indicates whether the vehicle has been used for special purposes, like commercial rental, driving school.

children.name: VehicleExteriorColor
children.description: The main color of the exterior within the basic color palette (eg. red, blue, black, white, ...).

children.name: VehicleInteriorColor
children.description: The color or color combination of the interior of the vehicle.

children.name: VehicleInteriorType
children.description: The type or material of the interior of the vehicle (e.g. synthetic fabric, leather, wood, etc.).

children.name: KnownVehicleDamages
children.description: A textual description of known damages, both repaired and unrepaired.

children.name: OptionalExtras
children.description: Optional extras refers to all car equipment options that are not installed as standard by the manufacturer.
children.comment: Allowed values are not standardized, each OEM can specify detail descriptions of array elements.

children.name: NominalVoltage
children.description: Nominal Voltage of the battery.
children.comment: Nominal voltage typically refers to voltage of fully charged battery when delivering rated capacity.

children.name: NominalCapacity
children.description: Nominal capacity of the low voltage battery.

children.name: CurrentVoltage
children.description: Current Voltage of the low voltage battery.

children.name: CurrentCurrent
children.description: Current current flowing in/out of the low voltage battery. Positive = Current flowing in to battery, e.g. during charging or driving. Negative = Current flowing out of battery, e.g. when using the battery to start a combustion engine.

children.name: Longitudinal
children.description: Vehicle acceleration in X (longitudinal acceleration).

children.name: Lateral
children.description: Vehicle acceleration in Y (lateral acceleration).

children.name: Vertical
children.description: Vehicle acceleration in Z (vertical acceleration).

children.name: Roll
children.description: Vehicle rotation rate along X (longitudinal).

children.name: Pitch
children.description: Vehicle rotation rate along Y (lateral).

children.name: Yaw
children.description: Vehicle rotation rate along Z (vertical).

children.name: IsConnected
children.description: Signal indicating if trailer is connected or not.

children.name: X
children.description: Mounting position of GNSS receiver antenna relative to vehicle coordinate system. Axis definitions according to ISO 8855. Origin at center of (first) rear axle. Positive values = forward of rear axle. Negative values = backward of rear axle.

children.name: Y
children.description: Mounting position of GNSS receiver antenna relative to vehicle coordinate system. Axis definitions according to ISO 8855. Origin at center of (first) rear axle. Positive values = left of origin. Negative values = right of origin. Left/Right is as seen from driver perspective, i.e. by a person looking forward.

children.name: Z
children.description: Mounting position of GNSS receiver on Z-axis. Axis definitions according to ISO 8855. Origin at center of (first) rear axle. Positive values = above center of rear axle. Negative values = below center of rear axle.

children.name: FixType
children.description: Fix status of GNSS receiver.

children.name: Timestamp
children.description: Timestamp from GNSS system for current location, formatted according to ISO 8601 with UTC time zone.

children.name: Latitude
children.description: Current latitude of vehicle in WGS 84 geodetic coordinates, as measured at the position of GNSS receiver antenna.

children.name: Longitude
children.description: Current longitude of vehicle in WGS 84 geodetic coordinates, as measured at the position of GNSS receiver antenna.

children.name: Heading
children.description: Current heading relative to geographic north. 0 = North, 90 = East, 180 = South, 270 = West.

children.name: HorizontalAccuracy
children.description: Accuracy of the latitude and longitude coordinates.

children.name: Altitude
children.description: Current altitude relative to WGS 84 reference ellipsoid, as measured at the position of GNSS receiver antenna.

children.name: VerticalAccuracy
children.description: Accuracy of altitude.

children.name: DTCCount
children.description: Number of Diagnostic Trouble Codes (DTC)

children.name: DTCList
children.description: List of currently active DTCs formatted according OBD II (SAE-J2012DA_201812) standard ([P|C|B|U]XXXXX )

children.name: TorqueTarget
children.description: Target axle torque in torque control mode, positive sign for torque in forward direction, negative sign for torque in backward direction (ISO8855).

children.name: TorqueMaximumLimit
children.description: Maximum allowed eAxle torque in rotation speed control mode, positive sign for torque in forward direction, negative sign unused.

children.name: TorqueMinimumLimit
children.description: Minimum allowed axle torque in rotation speed control mode, positive sign unused, negative sign for torque in backward direction (ISO8855).

children.name: RotationalSpeedTarget
children.description: Target axle rotational speed in rotation speed control mode, positive sign for rotation in forward direction, negative sign for rotation in backward direction.

children.name: RotationalSpeedMaximumLimit
children.description: Maximum allowed axle rotational speed in torque control mode, positive sign for rotation in forward direction, negative sign for rotation in backward direction.

children.name: RotationalSpeedMinimumLimit
children.description: Minimum allowed axle rotational speed in torque control mode, positive sign for rotation in forward direction, negative sign for rotation in backward direction.

children.name: Torque
children.description: Axle torque, positive sign for torque in forward direction, negative sign for torque in backward direction.

children.name: TorqueMaximum
children.description: Maximum momentarily available eAxle torque, positive sign for torque in forward direction, negative sign for torque in backward direction.

children.name: TorqueMinimum
children.description: Minimum momentarily available eAxle torque, positive sign for torque in forward direction, negative sign for torque in backward direction.

children.name: TorqueLongTermMaximum
children.description: Maximum long-term available eAxle torque, default time horizon = 10 sec, positive sign for torque in forward direction, negative sign for torque in backward direction.

children.name: TorqueLongTermMinimum
children.description: Minimum long-term available eAxle torque, default time horizon = 10 sec, positive sign for torque in forward direction, negative sign for torque in backward direction.

children.name: TorqueShortTermMaximum
children.description: Maximum short-term available eAxle torque, default time horizon = 1 sec, positive sign for torque in forward direction, negative sign for torque in backward direction.

children.name: TorqueShortTermMinimum
children.description: Minimum short-term available eAxle torque, default time horizon = 1 sec, positive sign for torque in forward direction, negative sign for torque in backward direction.

children.name: RotationalSpeed
children.description: Rotational speed for the specified axle, positive sign for rotation in forward direction, negative sign for rotation in backward direction.

children.name: TorqueTarget
children.description: Target axle torque in torque control mode, positive sign for torque in forward direction, negative sign for torque in backward direction (ISO8855).

children.name: TorqueMaximumLimit
children.description: Maximum allowed eAxle torque in rotation speed control mode, positive sign for torque in forward direction, negative sign unused.

children.name: TorqueMinimumLimit
children.description: Minimum allowed axle torque in rotation speed control mode, positive sign unused, negative sign for torque in backward direction (ISO8855).

children.name: RotationalSpeedTarget
children.description: Target axle rotational speed in rotation speed control mode, positive sign for rotation in forward direction, negative sign for rotation in backward direction.

children.name: RotationalSpeedMaximumLimit
children.description: Maximum allowed axle rotational speed in torque control mode, positive sign for rotation in forward direction, negative sign for rotation in backward direction.

children.name: RotationalSpeedMinimumLimit
children.description: Minimum allowed axle rotational speed in torque control mode, positive sign for rotation in forward direction, negative sign for rotation in backward direction.

children.name: Torque
children.description: Axle torque, positive sign for torque in forward direction, negative sign for torque in backward direction.

children.name: TorqueMaximum
children.description: Maximum momentarily available eAxle torque, positive sign for torque in forward direction, negative sign for torque in backward direction.

children.name: TorqueMinimum
children.description: Minimum momentarily available eAxle torque, positive sign for torque in forward direction, negative sign for torque in backward direction.

children.name: TorqueLongTermMaximum
children.description: Maximum long-term available eAxle torque, default time horizon = 10 sec, positive sign for torque in forward direction, negative sign for torque in backward direction.

children.name: TorqueLongTermMinimum
children.description: Minimum long-term available eAxle torque, default time horizon = 10 sec, positive sign for torque in forward direction, negative sign for torque in backward direction.

children.name: TorqueShortTermMaximum
children.description: Maximum short-term available eAxle torque, default time horizon = 1 sec, positive sign for torque in forward direction, negative sign for torque in backward direction.

children.name: TorqueShortTermMinimum
children.description: Minimum short-term available eAxle torque, default time horizon = 1 sec, positive sign for torque in forward direction, negative sign for torque in backward direction.

children.name: RotationalSpeed
children.description: Rotational speed for the specified axle, positive sign for rotation in forward direction, negative sign for rotation in backward direction.

children.name: TorqueFrictionMaximum
children.description: Maximum wheel torque request for friction brake. Brake Torque < 0Nm.

children.name: TorqueFrictionMinimum
children.description: Minimum wheel torque request for friction brake. Brake Torque < 0Nm.

children.name: OmegaUpper
children.description: Upper wheel speed limit request controlled by friction brake. ISO 8855 wheel-spin velocity.

children.name: OmegaLower
children.description: Lower wheel speed limit request controlled by friction brake. ISO 8855 wheel-spin velocity.

children.name: Torque
children.description: Estimated friction brake torque. Brake Torque < 0Nm.

children.name: TorqueArbitrated
children.description: Brake system internally calculated friction brake torque target. Brake Torque < 0Nm.

children.name: TorqueFrictionMaximum
children.description: Maximum wheel torque request for friction brake. Brake Torque < 0Nm.

children.name: TorqueFrictionMinimum
children.description: Minimum wheel torque request for friction brake. Brake Torque < 0Nm.

children.description: Upper wheel speed limit request controlled by friction brake. ISO 8855 wheel-spin velocity.

children.name: OmegaLower
children.description: Lower wheel speed limit request controlled by friction brake. ISO 8855 wheel-spin velocity.

children.description: Estimated friction brake torque. Brake Torque < 0Nm.

children.name: TorqueArbitrated
children.description: Brake system internally calculated friction brake torque target. Brake Torque < 0Nm.

children.name: TorqueElectricMinimum
children.description: Limit for regenerative brake torque at given axle. Brake Torque < 0Nm.

children.name: TorqueFrictionDifferenceMaximum
children.description: Maximum absolute wheel torque difference between left and right wheel for friction brake.

children.name: TorqueDistributionFrictionRightMaximum
children.description: Maximum distribution range of the friction brake request on the axle to the right wheel. 0% = Complete friction torque shall be shifted to the left wheel. 50% = At most 50% friction torque may be shifted to the right wheel. 100% = Complete friction torque may be shifted to the right wheel.

children.name: TorqueDistributionFrictionRightMinimum
children.description: Minimum distribution range of the friction brake request on the axle to the right wheel. 0% = Complete friction torque may be shifted to the left wheel. 50% = At least 50% friction torque shall be shifted to the right wheel. 100% = Complete friction torque shall be shifted to the right wheel.
