children.description: Minimum wheel torque request for friction brake. Brake Torque < 0Nm.

children.name: OmegaUpper
children.description: Upper wheel speed limit request controlled by friction brake. ISO 8855 wheel-spin velocity.

children.name: OmegaLower
children.description: Lower wheel speed limit request controlled by friction brake. ISO 8855 wheel-spin velocity.

children.name: Torque
children.description: Estimated friction brake torque. Brake Torque < 0Nm.

children.name: TorqueArbitrated
children.description: Brake system internally calculated friction brake torque target. Brake Torque < 0Nm.

children.name: TorqueElectricMinimum
children.description: Limit for regenerative brake torque at given axle. Brake Torque < 0Nm.

children.name: TorqueFrictionDifferenceMaximum
children.description: Maximum absolute wheel torque difference between left and right wheel for friction brake.

children.name: TorqueDistributionFrictionRightMaximum
children.description: Maximum distribution range of the friction brake request on the axle to the right wheel. 0% = Complete friction torque shall be shifted to the left wheel. 50% = At most 50% friction torque may be shifted to the right wheel. 100% = Complete friction torque may be shifted to the right wheel.

children.name: TorqueDistributionFrictionRightMinimum
children.description: Minimum distribution range of the friction brake request on the axle to the right wheel. 0% = Complete friction torque may be shifted to the left wheel. 50% = At least 50% friction torque shall be shifted to the right wheel. 100% = Complete friction torque shall be shifted to the right wheel.

children.name: VehicleForceMaximum
children.description: Maximum longitudinal brake force request (FxWhlSum). Sum of all tyre longitudinal forces. Brake Force < 0N.

children.name: VehicleForceElectric
children.description: Regenerative brake force request (FxWhlSum). Sum of all tyre longitudinal forces. Brake Force < 0N.

children.name: VehicleForceDistributionFrontMaximum
children.description: Maximum distribution range request of FxWhlSum to front axle. 0% = Complete longitudinal brake force shall be shifted to rear axle. 50% = At most 50% shall be shifted to front axle. 100%  = Complete longitudinal brake force may be shifted to front axle.

children.name: VehicleForceDistributionFrontMinimum
children.description: Minimum distribution range request of FxWhlSum to front axle. 0% = Complete longitudinal brake force may be shifted to rear axle. 50% = At least 50% shall be shifted to front axle. 100% = Complete longitudinal brake force shall be shifted to front axle.

children.name: VehicleForceElectricMinimumArbitrated
children.description: Brake system internally calculated regenerative force limit at vehicle level for eAxle actuation. Brake Force < 0N.

children.name: AngleTarget
children.description: Steering-wheel angle request to the steering actuator (external set-point for steer-by-wire). Positive sign for angle in counterclockwise direction (based on ISO8855).

children.name: AngleTargetMode
children.description: Mode used for controlling Steering-wheel angle interface. 0 indicates interface disabled. Other values activate vehicle specific modes.

children.name: TorqueOffsetTarget
children.description: Steering-wheel torque offset request to the steering actuator, added to the actuator internal calculated target value. Positive sign for torque in counterclockwise direction (based on ISO8855).

children.name: TorqueOffsetTargetMode
children.description: Mode used for controlling steering-wheel torque offset interface. 0 indicates interface disabled. Other values activate vehicle specific modes.

children.name: TorqueTarget
children.description: Steering-wheel torque request to the steering actuator (external set-point for steer-by-wire). Positive sign for torque in counterclockwise direction (based on ISO8855).

children.name: TorqueTargetMode
children.description: Mode used for controlling Steering-wheel torque interface. 0 indicates interface disabled. Other values activate vehicle specific modes.

children.name: Angle
children.description: Represents the current input angle of the steering system, typically corresponds to angle applied by driver on the steering-wheel. Positive for angle in counterclockwise direction (based on ISO8855).

children.name: Torque
children.description: Represents the current input torque for steering system, typically corresponds to torque applied by driver on the steering wheel. Positive for torque in counterclockwise direction (based on ISO8855).

children.name: RackPositionOffsetTarget
children.description: Rack position offset request to the axle steering actuator (for steer-by-wire), added to the actuator internal calculated set-point. Positive values without internal calculated set point change lead to a left movement of the vehicle (based on ISO8855).

children.name: RackPositionOffsetTargetMode
children.description: Mode used for controlling rack position offset interface of axle steering actuator. 0 indicates interface disabled. Other values activate vehicle specific modes.

children.name: RackPositionTarget
children.description: Rack position request to the axle steering actuator (external set-point). Positive values lead to a left turn of the vehicle (based on ISO8855).

children.name: RackPositionTargetMode
children.description: Mode used for controlling rack position interface of axle steering actuator. 0 indicates interface disabled. Other values activate vehicle specific modes.

children.name: RackPosition
children.description: Represents the current position of the steering rack on axle steering actuator. Positive values leads to a left turn of the vehicle (based on ISO8855).

children.name: TripMeterReading
children.description: Trip meter reading.
children.comment: The trip meter is an odometer that can be manually reset by the driver

children.name: PowerOptimizeLevel
children.description: Power optimization level for this branch/subsystem. A higher number indicates more aggressive power optimization. Level 0 indicates that all functionality is enabled, no power optimization enabled. Level 10 indicates most aggressive power optimization mode, only essential functionality enabled.

children.name: IsAutoPowerOptimize
children.description: Auto Power Optimization Flag When set to 'true', the system enables automatic power optimization, dynamically adjusting the power optimization level based on runtime conditions or features managed by the OEM. When set to 'false', manual control of the power optimization level is allowed.

children.name: StartTime
children.description: Start time of current or latest trip, formatted according to ISO 8601 with UTC time zone.
children.comment: This signal is supposed to be set whenever a new trip starts. A new trip is considered to start when engine gets enabled (e.g. LowVoltageSystemState in ON or START mode). A trip is considered to end when engine is no longer enabled. The default value indicates that the vehicle never has been started, or that latest start time is unknown.

children.name: RoofLoad
children.description: The permitted total weight of cargo and installations (e.g. a roof rack) on top of the vehicle.

children.name: CargoVolume
children.description: The available volume for cargo or luggage. For automobiles, this is usually the trunk volume.

children.name: EmissionsCO2
children.description: The CO2 emissions.

children.name: CurbWeight
children.description: Vehicle curb weight, including all liquids and full tank of fuel, but no cargo or passengers.

children.name: GrossWeight
children.description: Curb weight of vehicle, including all liquids and full tank of fuel and full load of cargo and passengers.

children.name: MaxTowWeight
children.description: Maximum weight of trailer.

children.name: MaxTowBallWeight
children.description: Maximum vertical weight on the tow ball of a trailer.

children.name: Length
children.description: Overall vehicle length.

children.name: Height
children.description: Overall vehicle height.

children.name: WidthExcludingMirrors
children.description: Overall vehicle width excluding mirrors, as defined by SAE J1100-2009 W103.

children.name: WidthIncludingMirrors
children.description: Overall vehicle width including mirrors, as defined by SAE J1100-2009 W144.

children.name: WidthFoldedMirrors
children.description: Overall vehicle width with mirrors folded, as defined by SAE J1100-2009 W145.

children.name: TurningDiameter
children.description: Minimum turning diameter, Wall-to-Wall, as defined by SAE J1100-2009 D102.

children.name: LowVoltageSystemState
children.description: State of the supply voltage of the control units (usually 12V).

children.name: Speed
children.description: Vehicle speed.

children.name: TraveledDistance
children.description: Odometer reading, total distance traveled during the lifetime of the vehicle.

children.name: TraveledDistanceSinceStart
children.description: Distance traveled since start of current trip.
children.comment: A new trip is considered to start when engine gets enabled (e.g. LowVoltageSystemState in ON or START mode). A trip is considered to end when engine is no longer enabled. The signal may however keep the value of the last trip until a new trip is started.

children.name: TripDuration
children.description: Duration of latest trip.
children.comment: This signal is not assumed to be continuously updated, but instead set to 0 when a trip starts and set to the actual duration of the trip when a trip ends. A new trip is considered to start when engine gets enabled (e.g. LowVoltageSystemState in ON or START mode). A trip is considered to end when engine is no longer enabled.

children.name: IsBrokenDown
children.description: Vehicle breakdown or any similar event causing vehicle to stop on the road, that might pose a risk to other road users. True = Vehicle broken down on the road, due to e.g. engine problems, flat tire, out of gas, brake problems. False = Vehicle not broken down.
children.comment: Actual criteria and method used to decide if a vehicle is broken down is implementation specific.

children.name: IsMoving
children.description: Indicates whether the vehicle is stationary or moving.

children.name: AverageSpeed
children.description: Average speed for the current trip.
children.comment: A new trip is considered to start when engine gets enabled (e.g. LowVoltageSystemState in ON or START mode). A trip is considered to end when engine is no longer enabled. The signal may however keep the value of the last trip until a new trip is started. Calculation of average speed may exclude periods when the vehicle for example is not moving or transmission is in neutral.

children.name: CurrentOverallWeight
children.description: Current overall Vehicle weight. Including passengers, cargo and other load inside the car.
